alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 12:55AM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine County, and Western and Central Chouteau County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Western and Central Chouteau County
